page.title: 04Bramhope: The Landscape
page.content: {LANDSCAPE:}183m above sea level in the NW the land dips centrally to 139m before rising to 157m at Crag Hill in the SW and Black Hill(152m)in the SE. On the NE the land falls sharply from 152m to the floodplain of the River Wharfe. {DRAINAGE:}Bramhope derives its name from "the place of the broom in the narrow valley leading to the under valley"-Pool Beck leading to the River Wharfe_other drainage trends are towards the SE_feeding Breary Marsh Golden Acre Park and Adel Dam_and South with 1 stream,eventually joining the River Aire. {GEOLOGY+SOILS:}Sandstone and shale predominate with some glacial till. Sand is being extracted commercially at Black Hill.22 soil samples were taken.Values ranged from pH8.0 to pH5.0
